course_title: Advanced Topics in Accounting Research I
course_description: This course explores institutional detail and research literatures related to financial reporting and disclosure incentives and choices in global capital markets. The focus is on what the firm hopes to accomplish with its financial reporting and disclosure choices, what institutional features of the market constrain its incentives and opportunities, and how it can customarily or best meet those goals.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the PhD program.
schedule_location: T 2pm-5pm in Goizueta Foundation Ctr W521
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1162, Section #: 5101, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 2-5p, Instructor: T. Yohn, Status: Closed
